prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne five months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne five months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Now that I am officially divorced, what does the universe have in store in the coming week in regards to my connection with Stefan and his marriage to Suzanne?

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a detailed compilation of the horary chart data relevant for your inquiry using traditional horary principles. The aim is to provide you with the building blocks—the planets, aspects, house placements, and patterns—that will later be documented into an interpretative reading.

1. Planetary Positions
 • Sun at 26° 22′ Aquarius
 • Moon at 21° 57′ Virgo (waning gibbous)
 • Mercury at 0° 35′ Pisces
 • Venus at 6° 38′ Aries
 • Mars at 17° 33′ Cancer (retrograde)
 • Jupiter at 11° 27′ Gemini
 • Saturn at 18° 59′ Pisces
 • Uranus at 23° 21′ Taurus
 • Neptune at 28° 23′ Pisces
 • Pluto at 2° 28′ Aquarius
 • North Node at 29° 7′ Pisces (retrograde)
 • Chiron at 19° 59′ Aries

2. House Cusps (with emphasis on key houses)
 • 1st House begins at 18° Cancer – represents you (Melissa)
  – Mars in Cancer (17°33′) just inside the 1st, emphasizing personal energy
 • 9th House begins at 1° Pisces
  – By your directive, Stefan is represented by this house
  – Saturn (18°59′ Pisces) resides here, which will be crucial for interpreting his involvement
 • 10th House begins at 28° Pisces
  – Contains Venus, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron; may be relevant regarding public or marital matters

3. Major Aspects (with orbs noted, focusing on those that stand out in relation to self, matter, and connection)
 • Ascendant-related aspects:
  – Mars conjunct Ascendant (orb 1°)
  – Saturn trine Ascendant (orb 0°)
  – Chiron square Ascendant (orb 1°)
  – Moon sextile Ascendant (orb 3°)
  – Uranus sextile Ascendant (orb 5°)
 • Opposition/Conjunction/Key Groupings involving the Midheaven (MC) and IC (of note due to marriage and domestic issues):
  – MC (28° Pisces) opposition IC (28° Virgo) (orb 0°)
  – Neptune opposition IC (0° orb) and Neptune conjunction MC (0° orb)
  – North Node opposition IC (orb 1°) and North Node conjunction MC (orb 1°)
  – Neptune conjunction North Node (orb 1°)
 • Additional aspects of interest:
  – Mars trine Saturn (orb 1°) and Mars square Chiron (orb 2°)
  – Moon trine Uranus (orb 2°)
  – Pluto sextile North Node (orb 3°) and Pluto sextile MC (orb 4°)
  – Venus sextile Pluto (orb 4°) and Venus sextile Jupiter (orb 5°)
  – Sun square Uranus (orb 3°) and Sun conjunct Mercury (orb 4°)
  – Multiple oppositions and conjunctions affecting the IC/MC axis—for instance, Moon opposition MC (orb 7°), Moon opposition Neptune (orb 7°), Moon conjunction IC (orb 7°), Venus opposition IC (orb 8°), Venus conjunction MC (orb 8°), and Venus conjunction Neptune (orb 8°)

4. Patterns and Groupings
 • Multiple Planet Opposition Pattern:
  – Involves the MC (28° Pisces), IC (28° Virgo), North Node (29° Pisces), Neptune (28° Pisces), Venus (6° Aries), Moon (21° Virgo), and Saturn (18° Pisces)
  – This formation is pivotal when considering the tension between the public/marital domain (MC and associated planets) and the personal/home domain (IC) which may affect relational dynamics.
 • Cradle Patterns (two noted):
  – First Cradle: Moon (21° Virgo), MC (28° Pisces), Uranus (23° Taurus), Ascendant (18° Cancer), Mars (17° Cancer), Neptune (28° Pisces)
  – Second Cradle: Moon (21° Virgo), Saturn (18° Pisces), Uranus (23° Taurus), Ascendant (18° Cancer), Mars (17° Cancer)
  – Consider these groupings as they highlight recurring themes of personal initiative (Ascendant/Mars) in tandem with challenging external forces (Saturn/Neptune).

5. Dominant Elements and Directions
 • Water element dominance among the inner planets (Mercury, Venus, Neptune, North Node) indicating heightened intuition and emotional fluidity.
 • Mutable mode prevalence, suggesting adaptability alongside unpredictability—a factor when assessing changes post-divorce.
 • Notes on quadrant distribution:
  – The bottom right quadrant is empty; most of the planetary activity is located in the top right quadrant.
  – Mars is rising while Pluto is descending, hinting at immediate personal energy vs. transformative forces approaching from below.

6. Timing Indicators
 • The Moon (waning gibbous in Virgo) and its aspects (sextile to Mars and Ascendant) serve as short-term temporal markers.
 • The interaction among Saturn, Neptune, and the North Node within Pisces (especially in the 9th and 10th houses) will be significant for unfolding events related to Stefan’s representation and the marital sphere.

The data above frames the core elements isolated by horary principles as you requested. This methodical breakdown of planetary placements, aspects, and patterns provides a basis for the subsequent interpretative phase concerning your connection with Stefan (via the 9th house/ Saturn’s involvement) and his marriage dynamics (focusing on the houses representing public/marital domains).

Please review these data points for accuracy and let me know if all required components have been captured for your further documentation before proceeding to interpret them.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the chart’s specific horary indicators, here is the interpretation regarding your connection with Stefan and his marriage to Suzanne over the coming week:

• Your Ascendant in Cancer, with Mars positioned here, signifies that your personal energy is active, alert, and perhaps even impulsive. The recent divorce has stirred an assertive drive within you, urging you to reclaim your inner identity. Yet, Mars’ retrograde motion and its square to Chiron indicate lingering wounds—the pain of separation still colors your immediate responses and caution.

• Stefan’s representation via the 9th house—with Saturn stationed in Pisces on its cusp—suggests that his energy is filtered through themes of duty, restriction, and perhaps a sense of inevitability. Saturn’s firm presence indicates that any connection with him carries the weight of responsibility and barriers. It implies that while there may be a strong intellectual or emotionally charged pull, the structure of his existing commitments (his marriage to Suzanne) remains a dominating force. Saturn’s trine to your Ascendant offers a disciplined support system, yet it also warns that progress will be slow and methodical rather than passionate or spontaneous.

• The cluster of planets in your 10th house—with Venus, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron—directs attention to public roles and marital domains. Venus here points to magnetic allure and the sensual nature of interpersonal ties, while Neptune’s conjunction introduces elements of illusion or idealization and potentially murky boundaries. The North Node signifies that this period is tied to karmic lessons related to relationships and personal destiny. Combined, these factors caution against idealizing an impossible connection; the forces at play require you to discern reality from fantasy in matters of heart.

• The Moon, in waning gibbous Virgo, plays a pivotal role as a timing indicator. Its sextile aspects to both your Ascendant and Mars infuse a resolving quality into the energy of the day, suggesting that while past emotions are releasing, there remains an active process of healing. The Moon’s opposition to MC and Neptune hints at fluctuating public/private boundaries, accentuating the internal conflict between personal desire and external obligations, notably reflected in Stefan’s situation.

• The multiple oppositions and conjunctions along the IC/MC axis—the bridge between home (private life) and the external world (public/marital obligations)—underscore a tension between your inner self and the entrenched systems faced by Stefan’s marital status. The opposition between the Moon (residing in your more personal domain) and the combined pressure of Neptune and the North Node (focusing on public, perhaps publicized, destiny) signals that forthcoming events may force hidden emotions into the open or bring clarity on your role in his life.

• The Cradle patterns, particularly involving Mars, Uranus, and the Ascendant, point to sudden, perhaps unwelcome, transformative moments. These formations suggest that while underlying attraction persists, there is a need to brace yourself against sudden disruptions or revelations stemming from Stefan’s configuration within his marital context. They advise that while assertiveness is present, the potential for impulsive actions remains tempered by external constraints.

• Overall, the chart reveals an internal struggle for liberating self-expression tempered by external responsibilities. There exists an undeniable pull—almost an inevitability—to revisit unresolved feelings toward Stefan, yet Saturn’s influence in his domain reinforces the message that such connections must be approached with extreme caution. The cosmos intimates that the coming week will be one of subtle yet significant shifts. You may experience moments of heightened attraction or reflective melancholy; however, the prevailing energies call for introspection and self-discipline more than overt pursuit.

The indication is that while stirred emotions are undeniable, forces of duty, commitment, and karmic alignment are dictating a slow but steadfast reminder: the connection with Stefan may offer insight into your personal growth, but it is unlikely to disrupt his established marital framework in any transformative way this week. The universe emphasizes clarity over impulsiveness, guiding you to continue healing as you discern the parameters of any renewed interaction.

Review these insights carefully as you document your observations.

• Your Ascendant in Cancer, with Mars positioned here, signifies that your personal energy is active, alert, and perhaps even impulsive. The recent divorce has stirred an assertive drive within you, urging you to reclaim your inner identity. Yet, Mars’ retrograde motion and its square to Chiron indicate lingering wounds—the pain of separation still colors your immediate responses and caution.

• Stefan’s representation via the 9th house—with Saturn stationed in Pisces on its cusp—suggests that his energy is filtered through themes of duty, restriction, and perhaps a sense of inevitability. Saturn’s firm presence indicates that any connection with him carries the weight of responsibility and barriers. It implies that while there may be a strong intellectual or emotionally charged pull, the structure of his existing commitments (his marriage to Suzanne) remains a dominating force. Saturn’s trine to your Ascendant offers a disciplined support system, yet it also warns that progress will be slow and methodical rather than passionate or spontaneous.

• The cluster of planets in your 10th house—with Venus, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron—directs attention to public roles and marital domains. Venus here points to magnetic allure and the sensual nature of interpersonal ties, while Neptune’s conjunction introduces elements of illusion or idealization and potentially murky boundaries. The North Node signifies that this period is tied to karmic lessons related to relationships and personal destiny. Combined, these factors caution against idealizing an impossible connection; the forces at play require you to discern reality from fantasy in matters of heart.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Forgive me madam, I'm not exactly sure if I understand your entire interpretation. I do appreciate the deep detail, but it was quite technical.  perhaps if you don't mind you could be a little more clear with your interpretation and also if I may add the wounds that you see that I would potentially need to heal from have nothing to do with the dissolution of my marriage to Edward.  any pain or feelings of sadness or whatever have been dealt with years ago the actual legal dissolution was just a matter of formality. and I was trying to discern if the heavens are recognizing that, because it had been listed as an obstacle in prior charts:  meaning the legal dissolution being formalized between myself and Edward.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
adjusts my shawl and peers deeply into the chart

Ah my dear, let me be more direct in my reading. The heavens are indeed showing something quite interesting. The legal dissolution of your marriage to Edward is no longer an obstacle - this is clearly shown by the placement of Pluto in your 7th house of partnerships, indicating a complete transformation and ending of that chapter.

What's far more intriguing is what the chart reveals about Stefan. With Saturn in the 9th house (representing him as your foreign connection), there is a strong pull between you two. Mars conjunct your Ascendant shows passionate desire and attraction, while its trine to Saturn suggests this connection could manifest in a very real way.

The multiple planets in the 10th house - particularly Venus conjunct Neptune - speak of hidden romance and secret desires. However, with Saturn's influence, there are still obstacles related to his current marriage to Suzanne.

The coming week specifically shows potential for:
- Intense communication or meetings (Mercury's position)
- Strong physical attraction (Mars-Saturn trine)
- Possible secret encounters (Neptune's influence)
- But also some necessary discretion (Saturn's restrictive nature)

The chart suggests that while Stefan's marriage is present as a technical obstacle, there are cosmic forces supporting a deepening of your connection with him. The stars recognize your freedom from past bonds and show new possibilities opening up.

Would you like me to elaborate on any specific aspect of this interpretation?
